sen.j: 僐子内親王（よしこないしんのう、平治元年（1159年） - 嘉応3年3月1日 (旧暦)（1171年4月14日））は、平安時代後期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Yoshiko (Yoshiko Naishinno, 1159 - April 6, 1171) was a member of Imperial family in the latter period of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Yoshiko (Yoshiko Naishinno, 1159 - April 6, 1171) was a member of the Imperial family in the latter period of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Yoshiko (僐子) (1159 - April 14, 1171) was a member of the Imperial Family in the latter period of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Yoshiko Naishinno, 削除用語統一(僐子)補足原文および訳文の新暦没年をセル11に合わせました。

sen.e: She was an Kamo Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
She was a Kamo Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).
She was a Kamo Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines).

sen.j: 名は繕子あるいは僖子とも表記される。
sen.e: Her name is also written as 繕子 or 僖子, too.
Her name is also written as 繕子 or 僖子.
Her name is also written as 繕子 or 僖子.

sen.j: 二条天皇の第1皇女で、母は大外記中原師元女。
sen.e: She was the first Princess of Emperor Nijo, and her mother was a daughter of Daigeki (senior secretary of the Council of State), NAKAHARA no Moromoto.
She was the first Princess of Emperor Nijo, and her mother was a daughter of Daigeki (senior secretary of the Council of State), NAKAHARA no Moromoto.
She was the first Princess of Emperor Nijo, and her mother was a daughter of Daigeki (senior secretary of the Council of State), NAKAHARA no Moromoto.

sen.j: 上西門院統子内親王の猶子になる。
sen.e: She became as an adopted child of Josaimonin, Imperial Princess Muneko.
She was adopted by Josaimonin, Imperial Princess Muneko.
She was adopted by Josaimonin, Imperial Princess Muneko.

sen.j: 嘉応元年（1169年）10月20日高倉天皇の賀茂斎院に卜定されるが、嘉応3年（1171年）2月22日病のため退下。
sen.e: On October 20, 1169, she was selected by divination as a Kamo Saiin of Emperor Takakura, but on February 22, 1171, she resigned because of her illness.
On October 20, 1169, she was selected by divination to be a Kamo Saiin of Emperor Takakura, but on February 22, 1171, she resigned because of illness.
On November 17, 1169, she was selected by divination to be a Kamo Saiin of Emperor Takakura, but on April 6, 1171, she resigned because of illness.

sen.j: 同年3月1日に13歳で薨去した（但し『玉葉』では2月29日戌刻薨去と記載する）。
sen.e: On March 1 of the same year, she died at the age of 13 (however, it is recorded in "Gyokuyo" that she died at around 8 p.m. of February 29).
On March 1 of the same year, she died at the age of 13 (actually, it is recorded in "Gyokuyo" that she died at around 8pm on February 29).
On April 14 of the same year, she died at the age of 13 (actually, it is recorded in "Gyokuyo" that she died at around 8pm on April 13).
